TextBody:
Hi Seungwook,

Before we can proceed further with the case, can you please provide us the following information:
•        What is the impact of the issue on your business?
•        Who is affected by this issue? How many machines are affected?
•        Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?
•        What are you trying to do or accomplish?
•        When did this issue start?
•        Can you please let us know the Client, Server, OS version (if not already known) on which the situation is encountered?
•        On what platform is your Endpoint Protector hosted? (on-prem, AWS, Google cloud platform, Azure, Hosted by EPP on AWS)
•        Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.
•        What other security solutions are you using?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Before we can proceed further with the case, can you please provide us the following information:
• What is the impact of the issue on your business?
Medium
A non-production issue; the majority of functions are still usable, a limited condition that can be readily circumvented.

• Who is affected by this issue? How many machines are affected?
It's just me. I'm testing

• Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?
I haven't been able to solve the problem

• What are you trying to do or accomplish?
I want the cap policy to be applied normally

• When did this issue start?
I don't know.

• Can you please let us know the Client, Server, OS version (if not already known) on which the situation is encountered?
- Client 2.4.3.1 - (Linux)
- Server 5.9.4.1
- Os Ubuntu 24.10

• On what platform is your Endpoint Protector hosted? (on-prem, AWS, Google cloud platform, Azure, Hosted by EPP on AWS)
on-premise

• Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.
I attached a video. Tell me if you need anything else

• What other security solutions are you using?
None. Only using endpoint protector
Subject: Netwrix Support Ticket #439714 - When DPI is turned on in a Ubuntu linux environment, the cap policy does not apply

TextBody:
Hi Seungwook,

Thank you for the details!
Ubuntu 24.10 is an interim release, which is maintained for 9 months. We only support the LTS (Long Term Support) versions of Ubuntu, such as 24.04.
You can technically use our clients, but they won't be 100% compatible, and that's why it's not working correctly.
You try with the latest version as well which was released Ubuntu for 24.04:
https://download.endpointprotector.com/linux_agent/EPPLinux_v2.4.4.1004/EPPClient_ubuntu_24.04_v2.4.4.1004_x86_64.tar.gz

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

Hello SEUNGWOOK,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00439714. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Number: 00439714
Ticket Subject: When DPI is turned on in a Ubuntu linux environment, the cap policy does not apply
Ticket Details: Hello, I'm Seungwook, an Endpoint Protector engineer.

If DPI is enabled in linux ubuntu, the cap policy does not seem to apply.

I set policy exit points to web browser and set policy denylist to block defined content/email.

I disable dpi and block as expected when uploading a document containing an e-mail to Chrome

However, if I enabled dpi and upload a document containing an email to Chrome, I do not block it, unlike what I expected.

I don't know why the above phenomenon occurs.

Additionally, the environment in which the client is installed is hubuntu 24.10 and kernel version 6.11.0-19-generic

Thank you.

From Seungwook.

Thank you!

Botond Biro
Technical Support Engineer
____________________ _________

www.netwrix.com
